LanguageData.ISF_EnergyTrackerInverseDesc: Specifies the flow direction of the energy.\n\nNon-inverted systems typically consume the energy unit (e.g. 100 -> 50 mana) and regain it over time; inverted energy trackers add the unit (e.g. 0 -> 25 mana) and reduce it over time.
LanguageData.ISF_EnergyTrackerUnderBarFactorDesc: A multiplier on recovery rate when the current energy level is below 0.
LanguageData.ISF_EnergyTrackerOverBarFactorDesc: A multiplier on recovery rate when the current energy level is above the maximum energy.
LanguageData.ISF_EnergyTrackerDeficitDesc: The change in {0} per second when in a {0} deficit.
LanguageData.ISF_EnergyTrackerOverchargeDesc: The change in {0} per second when in a {0} surplus.
LanguageData.ISF_EnergyStatDesc: The resource that pawns require to cast sorceries, upon which it is depleted (or in rare cases, gained).
LanguageData.ISF_EnergyTrackerTurnInfoDesc: The amount of time a "turn" (the period of time between automatic game pauses when the pawn is drafted) takes in seconds.
LanguageData.ISF_EnergyTrackerRefreshInfoDesc: The amount of time it takes a sorcery schema to refresh various values, often discrete casts, in seconds.
LanguageData.ISF_EnergyTrackerAmmoDesc: The source(s) of this schema's energy unit. Depending on schema, various sources can contribute differing amounts of energy units.
LanguageData.ISF_ButtonLearningTrackers: View various magic system aspects such as system summary, progression, abilities, etc.
LanguageData.ISF_ButtonLimit: Toggle whether this pawn can use energy beyond their limits.
LanguageData.ISF_ButtonTurnTimer: Toggle whether or not the game pauses at the end of this magic system's turn when this pawn is selected and drafted.
LanguageData.ISF_ButtonFav: Toggle whether or not this is a favorited system. Favorited systems can show up in the favorites view of the tab.
LanguageData.ISF_ButtonFavView: Toggle whether or not to view favorited systems.
